intro: Brodiaea setacea, commonly known as the slender brodiaea, is a flowering plant native to California and Baja California. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of white or pale purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, spherical bulbs that store nutrients, allowing it to survive in arid environments. Brodiaea setacea is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and chaparral.
